description: From Middle English surmounten, from Old French surmonter (“to rise above, surmount”), from sur- (“above”) + monter (“to mount”).

verbs.description: surmount (third-person singular simple present surmounts, present participle surmounting, simple past and past participle surmounted)

examples: this difficulty may perhaps be surmounted by care and art

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cap; to sit on top of.
